excerpts: I see the menu with its cinnamon sugar toast calling to me.
The problem?
I'm not a coffee drinker.
I came with one toast in mind and was so ready to finally get my hands on the cinnamon sugar toast.
cinnamon sugar toast.author: Kristen T.
cinnamon sugar toast.review:
This small but cute little coffee shop opened up a block down from us, and every morning on my walk to work I see the menu with its cinnamon sugar toast calling to me. The problem? I'm not a coffee drinker. So, I waited until the weekend to stop in with my coffee-loving boyfriend so we could give the place a try. 

First and foremost, the staff is lovely, and the place is so well presented. It's very small, only about seven or eight stools, but the menu is large. They have every kind of coffee you can think of, hot chocolate, and kombucha, and then a wide array of toasts. While their other customers ordered the healthier options of avocado toasts and such, and they all looked delicious...I came with one toast in mind and was so ready to finally get my hands on the cinnamon sugar toast. 

We ordered just that, with a hot chocolate for me and a standard brewed coffee for the boo. The food comes fast, the drinks even faster. My boyfriend liked the coffee, he said he'd definitely be back during the week since it's so close to our apartment. He also loves that they sell bags of Sightglass coffee, which he loves to buy and bring to work. 

The toast was delicious! Perfect size for one person, next time we will order two rather than sharing. But it was buttery, cinnamon and sugar deliciousness in every bite, I loved it. The butter makes the center a wee bit soggy, but then the sugar kind of melted into it there and I could not complain. 

So why four stars only? The hot chocolate. Of course this place is a coffee shop primarily and so it's understandable that the coffee is the priority. But for non-coffee drinkers like me, hot chocolates have become a go to option when friends wanna hit up a coffee shop. The hot chocolate here was waaaaaay too watered down, you legitimately can barely taste the chocolate. It feels like you're drinking warm chocolate water rather than hot chocolate and that's not a good look. Next time I go I wanna try to kombucha, and mention that they should maybe rework how they make the hot chocolate. 

Overall, super cute place with yummy food and good coffee. I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood!

excerpts: Thus far I've only tried their drip coffee and cinnamon sugar toast.
Both were amazing- the toast is on par with (maybe even better?)
The Mill, Jane, Philz, Dottie's True Blue, etc.
I look forward to trying every other thing on their menu.
cinnamon sugar toast.author: William M.
cinnamon sugar toast.review:
It's Sunday morning..I'm sitting up in bed listening to Phillip Glass and All Things Considered Morning Edition. The suns' warm glare is shining through the window and leaves flutter outside.  I just had a cup of rich, full bodied coffee and a fabulously delicious, generously sized slice of fresh bread slathered in butter and cinnamon + sugar.  WHAT a lovely way to spend a Sunday morning.  
Scullery just opened it's doors on the floor level of my apartment building.  On the corner of Geary and Leavenworth, this cafe is an oasis in the Tenderloin.  I've only found two other really good coffee shops in the TL, and they're a significant walk away (too far for a lazy morning when I'm not ready to fully engage with the city).  Most cafe's in the neighborhood offer overpriced, Folgers grade coffee, and stale and underwhelming pastries (Egregious, really). 

Thus far I've only tried their drip coffee and cinnamon sugar toast.  Both were amazing- the toast is on par with (maybe even better?) The Mill, Jane, Philz, Dottie's True Blue, etc. I look forward to trying every other thing on their menu.  Next on my list, the Tenderloin Cold Brew and Avocado toast. 

To sum it up: Super Stoked (!!) this place is here.  Quality (and pricing) is competitive with the best and most notable cafe's in the city, honestly.  

Owners: PLEASE offer larger sizes of coffee. Pretty pretty please. I will legit promise to buy coffee from you 3-5x per week if you begin offering a large size.  

Thank you! 5 Stars!

excerpts: I ordered a soy chai tea latte and a cream cheese toast with habanero mango jelly.
cream cheese toast.author: Tanya E.
cream cheese toast.review:
Went here for a quick bite and coffee with three of my girl friends. It is a cute little spot with about 4-5 stools lining the interior and 
a few out side seats as well. This is a place that seems very grab and go friendly, not somewhere you stay and chill. 

We ordered and shortly found some seats together inside, so the wait wasn't horrible for seats. I ordered a soy chai tea latte and a cream cheese toast with habanero mango jelly. My friends ordered a gibraltar (in between latte and a cappuccino), soy latte, avocado and pbj toast. 

All the coffee drinks were nicely made with those barista designs. My chai had the perfect spiciness and sweetness I look for. Out of all the toasts, my favorite was the avocado one. It was a close call that I didn't order it. But I knew that it would be much heavier so I went with the cream cheese. My toast was yummy. The jelly was a little spicy but not over bearing and there was a nice schmear of cream cheese to hold up to the multi grain toast. The pbj toast was good as well. The presentation was the best on this toast. 

The staff was mostly behind the coffee 'bar' and was eagar to help, but they were also very appreciative that the patrons would bring their trash and dirty dishes to the counter. 

I liked this place, def recommend checking it out.

excerpts: I had a latte and the cream cheese toast with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Cream cheese toast was really yummy too.
Reminded me of the toast at the Mill.
cream cheese toast.author: Semuteh F.
cream cheese toast.review:
Great addition to the neighborhood and this stretch of Geary! Along with Jane and Hookers, Scullery joins a great group of coffee shops in "tenderloin heights" and I'm very impressed with the coffee, food, and service after my first visit this morning.

The shop itself is pretty small--maybe 8 stools? Bright yellow stools and beautiful wood counter tops. I had a latte and the cream cheese toast with olive oil, salt and pepper. My partner had the sausage croissant from Jane.

Latte was ONE OF THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD! Give your barista a raise! So so good! Cream cheese toast was really yummy too. Reminded me of the toast at the Mill. Pastry was delicious--as expected--we love Jane pastries! 

Owner and people who work here are lovely and not pretentious. As with all new businesses in the rapidly gentrifying Tenderloin, I hope they donate leftover food to shelters/pantries and hire/train people from the neighborhood. A "charity of the month" jar and some sort of matching by the owner would also be a nice nod to the nabe. Can't wait to return!

excerpts: Came back two days later and ordered the cream cheese toast and the spicy pb and blackberry jelly
(they have some interesting spicy jellies
cream cheese toast.author: Jenn K.
cream cheese toast.review:
Such a simple concept of coffee and toast and it is SO dang good!

Was walking around for some coffee and randomly stumbled upon this cute little gem. Immediately my eyes read "avocado toast" so of course I had to have it and got myself a nice burnt caramel latte.

Avocado toast was EVERYTHANNNNNG! The garlic oil and the hefty amount of pepper was right up my alley and the bread is from the baker that used to work at Tartine so how can this not be a win?

Came back two days later and ordered the cream cheese toast and the spicy pb and blackberry jelly (they have some interesting spicy jellies but I wanted something sweet) and both were so good!

Please do yourself a favor and stop by this place -if not for the good coffee but that avocado toast!

excerpts: My husband and I got the cream cheese toast, black coffee and the burnt caramel latte.
The toast was phenomenal and decadent.
The latte had great flavor without being overly sweet.
The black coffee was delicious!
Picking a toast was challenging because they have so many delicious looking options!
Best of luck to you in making a selection.
I think you'll win no matter what.
cream cheese toast.author: Tiffany M.
cream cheese toast.review: Amazing! My husband and I got the cream cheese toast, black coffee and the burnt caramel latte. The toast was phenomenal and decadent. The latte had great flavor without being overly sweet. The black coffee was delicious! Picking a toast was challenging because they have so many delicious looking options! Best of luck to you in making a selection. I think you'll win no matter what.

excerpts: Split smoked trout toast and avocado toast with hubby.
Both were fantastic.
The bread by itself is heaven.
The burnt caramel coffee was possibly the best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life.
smoked trout toast.author: Jeffery M.
smoked trout toast.review: Split smoked trout toast and avocado toast with hubby. Both were fantastic. The bread by itself is heaven. The burnt caramel coffee was possibly the best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life. Hubby very much enjoyed his cafe au lait. Be aware though that there are only about six seats in the place so if you are eating there you might want to go early. I think they do take out but the coffee presentation is worth having it there.

excerpts: I had a chai latte with the smoked trout toast.
Very, very tasty and prices are average but the wait was FOREVER.
I wanted to like this place more because small spots are the norm in SF but the super long wait for a chai and toast with no one else in line deters me a bit.
Maybe one day.
smoked trout toast.author: Angela W.
smoked trout toast.review: Cute place but super tiny.  I had a chai latte with the smoked trout toast. Very, very tasty and prices are average but the wait was FOREVER.  I wanted to like this place more because small spots are the norm in SF but the super long wait for a chai and toast with no one else in line deters me a bit.  Maybe one day.

excerpts: Came back today and ordered the cold brew (which comes out of a nitro tap) and the smoked trout toast.
Soooooo delicious.
The owner makes the smoked trout herself from a recipe she got from her mother-in-law.
Very cute place, and super good.
It might seem a little pricey for just toast, but it's delicious and hardy enough that it's worth it.
smoked trout toast.author: Mary F.
smoked trout toast.review: Was walking by here yesterday and noticed they're whole menu was all toast - which is one of my favorite things to have for breakfast. Came back today and ordered the cold brew (which comes out of a nitro tap) and the smoked trout toast. Soooooo delicious. The owner makes the smoked trout herself from a recipe she got from her mother-in-law. Very cute place, and super good. It might seem a little pricey for just toast, but it's delicious and hardy enough that it's worth it.

excerpts:
I had the:

Welsh Rarebit Toast
$7.00+ham 
with Grilled aged farmhouse cheddar and yummy Chutney on top.
welsh rarebit toast.author: Leila H.
welsh rarebit toast.review:
Stopped by for the first time after reading all the great Yelp reviews! It's a great little spot to have in the Tenderloin. Of course, there's the pricey toast and coffee but it's worth it if you are looking for quality. I had the:

Welsh Rarebit Toast
$7.00+ham 
with Grilled aged farmhouse cheddar and yummy Chutney on top. 

Also, the very tasty:

Burnt Caramel Latte
$5.00+
Made with Recchiuti chocolate.

Overall, it cost me $14.50 but like I said, it's for the quality. Customer service was fantastic as well. Will be coming back.

excerpts: If you're hungry do not miss a chance to order a Welsh Rarebit toast - and you get to pick from a half dozen yummy chutneys they'll add on top.
They also have avocado toast and PB and
J. Everything is quick and scrumptious.
Totally recommend you stop here when you're in the neighborhood!
welsh rarebit toast.author: Sonya S.
welsh rarebit toast.review: This cafe is small but super cute! It's on my way to work which makes it convenient - and it's close to a lot of hotels in the Nob Hill area. It's away from the rushed busy-ness of Union Square. You order at the counter - menu has all the coffee drinks you'd expect but I usually go for a cup of PG Tips tea. If there's a stool free to sit at, say you want your order 'for here' and your hot drink comes served in a cute yellow cup and saucer with a little spoon that looks like it came from your granny's silverware drawer. If you're hungry do not miss a chance to order a Welsh Rarebit toast - and you get to pick from a half dozen yummy chutneys they'll add on top. They also have avocado toast and PB and J. Everything is quick and scrumptious. Totally recommend you stop here when you're in the neighborhood!

excerpts: I also ordered brewed coffee.
brewed coffee.author: Todd R.
brewed coffee.review:
The tiny place is adorable however the service and coffee was not. A young woman greeted me with a whisper and I placed my order. I kept asking her to repeat herself and finally she raised her voices level I could discern. The kippers sounded interesting. I also ordered brewed coffee. Prices are reasonable. 

Found myself a place at the window and took a sip of the coffee. Burnt. Prolly sitting on a warmer too long. It took an amazingly long time to toast bread and poach an egg. Since kippers are new to me I don't know if they were good. What I can say is the  smoked fish was dry. The egg was delicious and the toast it's served on grain filled and good. 

If I return I'll try something else.

excerpts: We ordered just that, with a hot chocolate for me and a standard brewed coffee for the boo.
The food comes fast, the drinks even faster.
My boyfriend liked the coffee, he said he'd definitely be back during the week since it's so close to our apartment.
brewed coffee.author: Kristen T.
brewed coffee.review:

It feels like you're drinking warm chocolate water rather than hot chocolate and that's not a good look. Next time I go I wanna try to kombucha, and mention that they should maybe rework how they make the hot chocolate. 

Overall, super cute place with yummy food and good coffee. I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood!

excerpts: The brewed coffee was just ok.
I wish that I had seen the pour over option earlier.
There were many toast options that I would come back for!
brewed coffee.author: Jana B.
brewed coffee.review: Avocado toast, your garlic oil, saltiness and thick bread saved me from an even worse hangover than I already had. Many thanks!!! I watched the man who made it for me and could tell that he infused it with some love energy. The brewed coffee was just ok. I wish that I had seen the pour over option earlier. There were many toast options that I would come back for!

excerpts: My Gibraltar was pretty good too.
gibraltar.author: Richard L.
gibraltar.review:
Another win here. Avocado toast - and I asked for the ghost pepper tomato chutney. Generous portion of chutney sitting atop the toast: sweet, fresh and just a dash of spice. Great combo. 

My Gibraltar was pretty good too.

excerpts: My friends ordered a gibraltar (in between latte and a cappuccino), soy latte, avocado and pbj toast.
gibraltar.author: Tanya E.
gibraltar.review:
Went here for a quick bite and coffee with three of my girl friends. It is a cute little spot with about 4-5 stools lining the interior and 
a few out side seats as well. This is a place that seems very grab and go friendly, not somewhere you stay and chill. 

We ordered and shortly found some seats together inside, so the wait wasn't horrible for seats. I ordered a soy chai tea latte and a cream cheese toast with habanero mango jelly. My friends ordered a gibraltar (in between latte and a cappuccino), soy latte, avocado and pbj toast. 

All the coffee drinks were nicely made with those barista designs. My chai had the perfect spiciness and sweetness I look for. Out of all the toasts, my favorite was the avocado one. It was a close call that I didn't order it. But I knew that it would be much heavier so I went with the cream cheese. My toast was yummy. The jelly was a little spicy but not over bearing and there was a nice schmear of cream cheese to hold up to the multi grain toast. The pbj toast was good as well. The presentation was the best on this toast. 

The staff was mostly behind the coffee 'bar' and was eagar to help, but they were also very appreciative that the patrons would bring their trash and dirty dishes to the counter. 

I liked this place, def recommend checking it out.

excerpts: Ordered a Gibraltar and a toast w/butter.
Both were top notch and full of flavor.
The Gibraltar was creaming and milk steamed to perfection, I think their espresso is very good too.
Now the toast was amazing, big thick slice of bakery fresh multi grain goodness and spread with the perfect amount of warm butter.
Like the aesthetic of the place and cute little front seating room.
Service was friendly and helpful.
gibraltar.author: Andruw M.
gibraltar.review: Ordered a Gibraltar and a toast w/butter. Both were top notch and full of flavor. The Gibraltar was creaming and milk steamed to perfection, I think their espresso is very good too. Now the toast was amazing, big thick slice of bakery fresh multi grain goodness and spread with the perfect amount of warm butter. Like the aesthetic of the place and cute little front seating room. Service was friendly and helpful.

excerpts: Strongly recommend the Gibraltar.
I'd go back just for that.
gibraltar.author: Nandini V.
gibraltar.review: Great avocado toast. Strongly recommend the Gibraltar. I'd go back just for that.

excerpts: Get the burnt caramel latte and the welsh rarebit with ham.
Their toast is really good, pretty thick but really soft inside.
burnt caramel latte.author: Mona B.
burnt caramel latte.review:
I was in San Fran for Dreamforce for a week and ended up going to this place three days in a row, even though it was a mile from my hotel, because it was that good!  

Get the burnt caramel latte and the welsh rarebit with ham.  Their toast is really good, pretty thick but really soft inside.  Their ingredients are high quality and you can tell very fresh. 

I did have the avocado toast as well, but I think I'm just not an avocado toast person (that was my first and last time trying it).

excerpts: The owner hand-makes the pumpkin mash they use in their seasonal latte, and all of their "sweeter" drinks - mocha, pumpkin spice, and burnt caramel latte (!!!)
- are designed to be low on sweetness factor.
The space is small- just a few bar seats in the windows.
So it's not a place to post up with your laptop!
But a very cute spot for a great coffee & toast of all kinds.
burnt caramel latte.author: Marjory G.
burnt caramel latte.review: A total gem in a sea of chains and nothingness! Their seeded sourdough bread is unbelievable and the place has a very cozy locals stop-in vibe. The owner hand-makes the pumpkin mash they use in their seasonal latte, and all of their "sweeter" drinks - mocha, pumpkin spice, and burnt caramel latte (!!!) - are designed to be low on sweetness factor. The space is small- just a few bar seats in the windows. So it's not a place to post up with your laptop! But a very cute spot for a great coffee & toast of all kinds.

excerpts: Highly recommend the burnt caramel latte.
Cool minimalist decor that doesn't overwhelm in a small space.
It's a tiny space so either get there early and snag a seat or grab your coffee to go.
One of the best coffee places in the city!
burnt caramel latte.author: Sarah N.
burnt caramel latte.review: What a gem! So glad this place is in my neighborhood! Delicious toast with gluten free bread option. Highly recommend the burnt caramel latte. Cool minimalist decor that doesn't overwhelm in a small space. It's a tiny space so either get there early and snag a seat or grab your coffee to go. One of the best coffee places in the city!

excerpts: Don't forget to add the Burnt Caramel Latte, superb with a little bit of cinnamon and brown sugar.
Parking is not terrible, especially during the week.
Though it is quaint, I always score a seat to dine-in (:
burnt caramel latte.author: Kimberly P.
burnt caramel latte.review: The BEST avocado toast of your LIFE! This is my go-to place for avocado toast! Yes, it's something you can probably make at home. HOWEVER, I am a woman of convenience and I am always down for a place that makes my life a little easier. Anyway, depending on who makes your toast will determine the enjoyment you will have(that's why i deducted a star) LOL ! Always a good meal after a morning run. Don't forget to add the Burnt Caramel Latte, superb with a little bit of cinnamon and brown sugar. Parking is not terrible, especially during the week. Though it is quaint, I always score a seat to dine-in (:

excerpts: Burnt caramel latte...
no questions asked, just order it now
burnt caramel latte.author: Pattie L.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Hidden gem alert!!!! Little space that serves up a great cup of coffee and even better toast options.. 
you might be asking now .. toast? What? 

Now order the follow and judge for yourself; 
-Avocado toast: if you like avocado you'll LOVE this 
-Cream cheese toast with oil and fresh cracked pepper was bomb! 

As for the coffee? 
Burnt caramel latte... no questions asked, just order it now

excerpts: I had the burnt caramel latte and it was great!
The server was very attentive and quick.
Payment is easy.
This place is more of a stop and go place, there is not really room to sit down for a while
so maybe grab coffee to walk around.
burnt caramel latte.author: Nathan B.
burnt caramel latte.review: Fairly expensive for a coffee, but I thought it was worth it for a nice treat. I had the burnt caramel latte and it was great! The server was very attentive and quick. Payment is easy. This place is more of a stop and go place, there is not really room to sit down for a while so maybe grab coffee to walk around.

excerpts: Immediately my eyes read "avocado toast" so of course I had to have it and got myself a nice burnt caramel latte.
burnt caramel latte.author: Jenn K.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Such a simple concept of coffee and toast and it is SO dang good!

Was walking around for some coffee and randomly stumbled upon this cute little gem. Immediately my eyes read "avocado toast" so of course I had to have it and got myself a nice burnt caramel latte.

Avocado toast was EVERYTHANNNNNG! The garlic oil and the hefty amount of pepper was right up my alley and the bread is from the baker that used to work at Tartine so how can this not be a win?

Came back two days later and ordered the cream cheese toast and the spicy pb and blackberry jelly (they have some interesting spicy jellies but I wanted something sweet) and both were so good!

Please do yourself a favor and stop by this place -if not for the good coffee but that avocado toast!

excerpts: Coffee (burnt caramel latte) was delicious.
We didn't get any food on this stop, but the roasts that were coming out of the oven was amazing.
We ordered a cup of milk for our daughter, even the milk was awesome.
burnt caramel latte.author: Megan C.
burnt caramel latte.review: Coffee (burnt caramel latte) was delicious. We didn't get any food on this stop, but the roasts that were coming out of the oven was amazing. We ordered a cup of milk for our daughter, even the milk was awesome.

excerpts: The burnt caramel latte ($5) is made with Recchiuti caramel - you can find their shop at the Ferry Building and it tastes delicious - so unlike the syrupy, overly sweet caramel lattes you get at Starbucks.
burnt caramel latte.author: Christina L.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Such a cute little hole in the wall place in the Tenderloin and fantastic toast (lots of chutneys to choose from, and avocado toast), and coffee. They use high quality products (the chutneys), the bread is delicious with filled with seeds and other grains, and they have sweet and savory choices for the toast.

The place is really tiny with only about 8 seats so if you're planning to come here on a date or with more than 2 people, you may want to try somewhere else. There's not a lot of seating and it's all bar seating along the wall/window, so it's not somewhere to come and eat/do work for hours on end.

It's not necessarily cheap but the ingredients are all excellent, so it warrants the higher prices. The burnt caramel latte ($5) is made with Recchiuti caramel - you can find their shop at the Ferry Building and it tastes delicious - so unlike the syrupy, overly sweet caramel lattes you get at Starbucks. If you like caramel and coffee, get this latte - you won't be disappointed.

The avocado toast ($8) was really good - I liked the bread a lot: pretty hearty with seeds/grains for more wholesome bread. The avocado was sliced and there was a generous amount - it was tasty with the garlic oil, salt, and pepper. I'm still partial to the avocado toast at Jane because I love the pickled onions and the poached egg. But this is a close second or third to Jane -- I also like Provender in Potrero for avocado toast.

I'll definitely come back here again for coffee and toast. Can't wait to try the one with cheese, and chutney - there are so many different variants to try. I'd give this 4.5 stars, taking off 0.5 stars because it's a little cramped/crowded and the food will take 5-10 min to make (so plan accordingly if you're in a hurry). But excellent & cute and a great addition to the Tenderloin.

excerpts: A delicious burnt caramel latte, where you could actually taste the flavor of the caramel without being too sweet.
burnt caramel latte.author: Josh G.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Perhaps the most memorable coffee I've had in recent memory. A delicious burnt caramel latte, where you could actually taste the flavor of the caramel without being too sweet. Pair this with some delicious avocado toast, and you've got a grand start to the day! 

My only gripe was that there was perhaps too much avocado (gasp!) on the toast. It was perfectly ripe and topped with salt and a garlicky oil, but I ended up scraping off 1/3, just so I could fit it in my mouth.

excerpts: The burnt caramel latte was a touch of heaven.
No need for sweetener, but also not too sweet.
burnt caramel latte.author: John G.
burnt caramel latte.review:
My wife and I recently visited a long time friend in San Francisco and found ourselves at Scullery two out of the four mornings we had in SF.  The burnt caramel latte was a touch of heaven.  No need for sweetener, but also not too sweet.  It had a rich flavor without being overpowering.  

The avocado toast was good on our first visit...it does not soggy up the toast as it is neatly sliced and placed the toast and seasoned with cracked pepper and sea salt.  It also checked the box on "white boy hipster who loves avocado ate avocado" which I was hoping to do since I booked my flight.  My wife, however, hit it big by ordering the Welsh Rarebit.  It is a simple dish - thick whole grain toast with melted aged cheddar.  The wife threw a curveball and asked for an overeasy egg on top.  You can also add ham or turkey.  I had one bite and was sold.  Our first visit was great as we had a long chat with Mauricio and Chow and they gave us great recommendations for things to do and places to see around the many o.  Side note - it's not in the heart of skid row, but it is right on the edge of it.  RIGHT on the edge.  You often see seedy characters walking by and even peeking in to ask for money.   We were thrown and upset by the homeless situation.  Aside from that, we would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves great, unique, and delicious food and drink served with a smile.

excerpts: I did get the burnt caramel latte and was SO WORTH IT.
Don't miss it.
burnt caramel latte.author: Ginny S.
burnt caramel latte.review: Wow. Whata latte!   Burnt caramel. We happened upon this tiny eatery while grabbing a breakfast sandwich next door.  As I told the friendly gentleman behind the counter, if I had only seen his sign before we ordered. Everything on the menu looked wonderful I did get the burnt caramel latte and was SO WORTH IT. Don't miss it.

excerpts:
Also, the very tasty:

Burnt Caramel Latte
$5.00+
Made with Recchiuti chocolate.
burnt caramel latte.author: Leila H.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Stopped by for the first time after reading all the great Yelp reviews! It's a great little spot to have in the Tenderloin. Of course, there's the pricey toast and coffee but it's worth it if you are looking for quality. I had the:

Welsh Rarebit Toast
$7.00+ham 
with Grilled aged farmhouse cheddar and yummy Chutney on top. 

Also, the very tasty:

Burnt Caramel Latte
$5.00+
Made with Recchiuti chocolate.

Overall, it cost me $14.50 but like I said, it's for the quality. Customer service was fantastic as well. Will be coming back.

excerpts: Ordered their burnt caramel latte which was perfectly sweet!
They also have a variety of toasts which I will be back to try!
burnt caramel latte.author: Kat T.
burnt caramel latte.review: Delicious coffee located near union square. Ordered their burnt caramel latte which was perfectly sweet! They also have a variety of toasts which I will be back to try!

excerpts: I've tried the burnt caramel latte
and it's AMAZING, but I save it for a treat every now and then.
burnt caramel latte.author: Rachael C.
burnt caramel latte.review:
Still my favorite spot in the neighborhood! I used to walk to Jane every Saturday for breakfast, but I've switched it up and made Scullery my coffee shop of choice. I also grab a latte on the way to work once or twice a week. 

They've expanded their menu, but I rarely stray from the avocado toast (without butter - makes it vegan!) and soy latte. I've tried the burnt caramel latte and it's AMAZING, but I save it for a treat every now and then. The welsh rarebit it delicious and they get pastries from Jane, if you're ever in the mood for a croissant, they stock the best.

Everyone who works here is really nice and I just generally enjoy the atmosphere. Things may take a bit longer sometimes, but it's worth it. It's great to see them doing so well! :)

excerpts: My husband and I got the cream cheese toast, black coffee and the burnt caramel latte.
The toast was phenomenal and decadent.
The latte had great flavor without being overly sweet.
The black coffee was delicious!
Picking a toast was challenging because they have so many delicious looking options!
Best of luck to you in making a selection.
I think you'll win no matter what.
burnt caramel latte.author: Tiffany M.
burnt caramel latte.review: Amazing! My husband and I got the cream cheese toast, black coffee and the burnt caramel latte. The toast was phenomenal and decadent. The latte had great flavor without being overly sweet. The black coffee was delicious! Picking a toast was challenging because they have so many delicious looking options! Best of luck to you in making a selection. I think you'll win no matter what.

excerpts: Get the burnt caramel or chai latte.
chai latte.author: Amy G.
chai latte.review:
Delicious lattes! Get the burnt caramel or chai latte. They also have a large offering of unique tasting toasts that I haven't tried yet.

Cool, bright ambiance but seating is very limited, so very much a grab and go place.

excerpts: I had the chai latte, which was quite good, but the standouts are their toasts:
chai latte.author: Cynthia X.
chai latte.review:
Delicious. Small cafe, quick and friendly service. They even made some sample cold brew for us to try while we were in the shop. 

I had the chai latte, which was quite good, but the standouts are their toasts:

The avocado toast: so simple, yet packed with flavor. I think they use a garlic oil or something with generous amounts of salt and fresh cracked pepper

Spicy ABJ: almond butter and your choice of jam on toast; I chose the passion fruit habanero jam; very tasty, but I wish the jam had more of a kick. I could barely taste the habanero.

Limited bar seating, but it's kind of an in and out type of place. Perfect for those lazy Sundays, when you wake up late, want a bite, but don't want to wait hours at typical breakfast and brunch places.

excerpts: I had a chai latte with the smoked trout toast.
Very, very tasty and prices are average but the wait was FOREVER.
I wanted to like this place more because small spots are the norm in SF but the super long wait for a chai and toast with no one else in line deters me a bit.
Maybe one day.
chai latte.author: Angela W.
chai latte.review: Cute place but super tiny.  I had a chai latte with the smoked trout toast. Very, very tasty and prices are average but the wait was FOREVER.  I wanted to like this place more because small spots are the norm in SF but the super long wait for a chai and toast with no one else in line deters me a bit.  Maybe one day.

excerpts: I ordered a $3.50 Cafe au Lait which met my immediate caffeine needs
(photo: http://bit.ly/2OVRct5).
For breakfast, they serve nine different toasts as well as daily specials like English breakfast and pesto eggs.
Toasts range from plain with salted butter to Smoked Trout to Welsh Rarebit with ham and chutney.
I wasn't feeling entirely adventurous and went with the $8 Avocado Toast drizzled with garlic oil and rock salt
(photo: http://bit.ly/2LbHnEJ).
It was more delicious than I expected
and I was fortunate enough to have a stool.
cafe au lait.author: Ed U.
cafe au lait.review:
Eating toast in a closet doesn't strike me as the basis of a sound business model. It sounds like my childhood. "Yes, Mommy, I'm in the closet. I'm not getting crumbs on your chinchilla." This place showed up on the Yelp app as a place to have breakfast in the 'Loin. I figured it was going to be a greasy spoon coffee shop with a cigarette dangling from the cook's mouth. But no, it's a much classier affair with a marble countertop, white subway tiles, and reclaimed wood beams to sit at. The challenge occurs when there are more than four customers and you have to find an open place to take your order. Did I mention it's in the Tenderloin?

They serve Five Mountains teas, make all the usual suspects with Sightglass Coffee, and use Recchuiti chocolate in their mochas and hot chocolates. Fancy. I ordered a $3.50 Cafe au Lait which met my immediate caffeine needs (photo: http://bit.ly/2OVRct5). For breakfast, they serve nine different toasts as well as daily specials like English breakfast and pesto eggs. Toasts range from plain with salted butter to Smoked Trout to Welsh Rarebit with ham and chutney. I wasn't feeling entirely adventurous and went with the $8 Avocado Toast drizzled with garlic oil and rock salt (photo: http://bit.ly/2LbHnEJ). It was more delicious than I expected and I was fortunate enough to have a stool. I mean the kind you sit on.

FOOD/COFFEE - 4 stars...a nice light breakfast that manages to satisfy
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...nice upscale touches...in a closet
SERVICE - 4 stars...two-person operation, very polite
TOTAL - 4 stars...toast is a many splendored thing

RELATED - Looking for other places to eat in the Tenderloin? Here are the places I have visited and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2MAPqN5

excerpts: I took a cafe au lait, I felt it was a bit too strong for me, not bad though.
I did not see how they make it.
My boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich, which was very good too, and a matcha latte that he didnt like.
I cannot judge since I hate matcha latte anyways!
It is a tiny coffee/breakfast place with 2 nice staff, something like 6 seats around the walls.
It is very clean, simple design and not pretentious.
If you are staying or living in the tenderloin I think it is your best bet for a small breakfast.
cafe au lait.author: Adeline M.
cafe au lait.review:
I went to Scullery because I was craving for an avocado toast. It is a perfect balance with the garlic oil, the sea salt and the avocado slices.
I took a cafe au lait, I felt it was a bit too strong for me, not bad though. I did not see how they make it. My boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich, which was very good too, and a matcha latte that he didnt like. 
I cannot judge since I hate matcha latte anyways! 
It is a tiny coffee/breakfast place with 2 nice staff, something like 6 seats around the walls. It is very clean, simple design and not pretentious. If you are staying or living in the tenderloin I think it is your best bet for a small breakfast.

excerpts: Hubby very much enjoyed his cafe au lait.
Be aware though that there are only about six seats in the place so if you are eating there you might want to go early.
I think they do take out but the coffee presentation is worth having it there.
cafe au lait.author: Jeffery M.
cafe au lait.review: Split smoked trout toast and avocado toast with hubby. Both were fantastic. The bread by itself is heaven. The burnt caramel coffee was possibly the best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life. Hubby very much enjoyed his cafe au lait. Be aware though that there are only about six seats in the place so if you are eating there you might want to go early. I think they do take out but the coffee presentation is worth having it there.

excerpts: Nitro Cold Brew
- I like my coffee just plain black and bold, this was right up my alley.
The sun was out and it was a bit warm, so the cold brew was refreshing.
nitro cold brew.author: Ann S.
nitro cold brew.review:
I remember a time when the Tenderloin was just plain ol' dirty, urglie, and janky stanky. And with the conflicting feelings of San Francisco gentrification and hipster revelation, I can't help but feel that (in a whisper's voice) it's kind of a cool thing that this kind of newness is taking over... minus any snooty pretentiousness or the drones of "yo, bro!" from crowds of yuppies, but of course. Oh no. Here at Scullery, you get a good blend of modern and easy coolness, an eclectic mix of earth and industrial. This tiny coffee shop is as neutral and as "Can't we all just get along?" as it gets.  

Here is where Old SF and New SF can unite. 

My order:

Spicy Plum Toast - This toast was a thicker cut and served nice and warm. I decided on the spicy plum jelly, not too sweet, really delicious. Since the toast was warm, the jelly seeped right into every cranny. YUM!

Nitro Cold Brew - I like my coffee just plain black and bold, this was right up my alley. The sun was out and it was a bit warm, so the cold brew was refreshing. Great contrast to the sweetness from the spicy plum jelly.

Avocado Toast - Fresh and filling. The avocado was ripened to perfection, not too soft and can stand on its own. The garlic oil and simple sea salt along with the cracked pepper were a perfect addition. This bread was also of a thicker cut. 

Americano - I got mine with a quadruple shot. This did the trick. It was strongggggg

Service was quick and helpful. They do have some items that are rotating on their menu, so what may be available one week, may not be the next. They do serve
Sightglass coffee and provide baked goods from local bakeries. Seating is very limited here. Prices are on par with the blossoming area, but the quality of the food is worth it.

excerpts: Nitro cold brew on tap, fat avocado halves on thick toast, savory-sweetest jams and chutneys; yes, please!
This newly opened and newly discovered gem is my jam!
Service with a smile: We enjoyed casual conversation (and passion fruit, habanero jam samples), while the breakfast baristas whipped up a little magic in a cup and on a platter.
Wanna get a smile slathered on your face?!
Start your day with Scullary!
PS-
The space can be a bit too cozy at times, as the cafe fills up fast
nitro cold brew.author: Peter W.
nitro cold brew.review:
Nitro cold brew on tap, fat avocado halves on thick toast, savory-sweetest jams and chutneys; yes, please! This newly opened and newly discovered gem is my jam! 
Service with a smile: We enjoyed casual conversation (and passion fruit, habanero jam samples), while the breakfast baristas whipped up a little magic in a cup and on a platter. 
Wanna get a smile slathered on your face?! Start your day with Scullary!
PS- The space can be a bit too cozy at times, as the cafe fills up fast

excerpts: Very friendly staff, good electronic music playing, and delicious nitro cold brew.
Great place to grab a coffee and a bite
, I saw toast and other good stuff on the menu.
nitro cold brew.author: Paul G.
nitro cold brew.review: Very friendly staff, good electronic music playing, and delicious nitro cold brew. Great place to grab a coffee and a bite, I saw toast and other good stuff on the menu.

excerpts: My go to's are the Nola Kola with almond milk (wish they had larger sizes so I could get more of it at one time) and the Avo Toast.
Recently tried the Pesto Egg Toast which was yummyyyy also appreciate that they are consistently bring in new menu options.
I live a block away and call ahead to get my toast made so its ready for pick-up when I get there!
Staff is friendly and the interior/branding are spot on.
nola kola.author: Raissa H.
nola kola.review: LOVE this newish neighborhood spot! My go to's are the Nola Kola with almond milk (wish they had larger sizes so I could get more of it at one time) and the Avo Toast. Recently tried the Pesto Egg Toast which was yummyyyy also appreciate that they are consistently bring in new menu options. I live a block away and call ahead to get my toast made so its ready for pick-up when I get there! Staff is friendly and the interior/branding are spot on.

excerpts: They have every kind of coffee you can think of, hot chocolate, and kombucha, and then a wide array of toasts.
While their other customers ordered the healthier options of avocado toasts and such, and they all looked delicious...
I wanna try to kombucha, and mention that they should maybe rework how they make the hot chocolate.
kombucha.author: Kristen T.
kombucha.review:
This small but cute little coffee shop opened up a block down from us, and every morning on my walk to work I see the menu with its cinnamon sugar toast calling to me. The problem? I'm not a coffee drinker. So, I waited until the weekend to stop in with my coffee-loving boyfriend so we could give the place a try. 

First and foremost, the staff is lovely, and the place is so well presented. It's very small, only about seven or eight stools, but the menu is large. They have every kind of coffee you can think of, hot chocolate, and kombucha, and then a wide array of toasts. While their other customers ordered the healthier options of avocado toasts and such, and they all looked delicious...I came with one toast in mind and was so ready to finally get my hands on the cinnamon sugar toast. 

We ordered just that, with a hot chocolate for me and a standard brewed coffee for the boo. The food comes fast, the drinks even faster. My boyfriend liked the coffee, he said he'd definitely be back during the week since it's so close to our apartment. He also loves that they sell bags of Sightglass coffee, which he loves to buy and bring to work. 

The toast was delicious! Perfect size for one person, next time we will order two rather than sharing. But it was buttery, cinnamon and sugar deliciousness in every bite, I loved it. The butter makes the center a wee bit soggy, but then the sugar kind of melted into it there and I could not complain. 

So why four stars only? The hot chocolate. Of course this place is a coffee shop primarily and so it's understandable that the coffee is the priority. But for non-coffee drinkers like me, hot chocolates have become a go to option when friends wanna hit up a coffee shop. The hot chocolate here was waaaaaay too watered down, you legitimately can barely taste the chocolate. It feels like you're drinking warm chocolate water rather than hot chocolate and that's not a good look. Next time I go I wanna try to kombucha, and mention that they should maybe rework how they make the hot chocolate. 

Overall, super cute place with yummy food and good coffee. I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood!
